Package org.forgerock.openidm.external.rest

Class RestService

java.lang.Object
org.forgerock.openidm.external.rest.RestService
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.forgerock.json.resource.SingletonResourceProvider
public class RestService extends Object implements org.forgerock.json.resource.SingletonResourceProvider
Service that acts as a HTTP client proxy to external REST services.

    static final String
    ARG_FORCE_WRAP
    Optional _action=call JSON key for HTTP request, indicating that the response must be wrapped in the headers/body JSON message-format, even if the response was JSON and would otherwise have been passed-through unchanged.

    Optional _action=call JSON key for HTTP request headers.

      Required _action=call JSON key for URL to request. The corresponding JSON value is type string.

    • ARG_METHOD

      public static final String ARG_METHOD
      Required _action=call JSON key for request HTTP method (e.g., get, post, etc.). The corresponding JSON value is type string.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARG_HEADERS

      public static final String ARG_HEADERS
      Optional _action=call JSON key for HTTP request headers. The corresponding JSON value is an object of key-value pairs.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARG_CONTENT_TYPE

      public static final String ARG_CONTENT_TYPE
      Optional _action=call JSON key for HTTP request Content-Type header, which is only applied to the request if ARG_HEADERS does not provide a Content-Type. The default Content-Type, when none is provided, is application/json; charset=utf-8. The corresponding JSON value is type string.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARG_BODY

      public static final String ARG_BODY
      Optional _action=call JSON key for HTTP request payload. The corresponding JSON value is type string.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARG_BASE_64

      public static final String ARG_BASE_64
      Optional _action=call JSON key for HTTP request, indicating that ARG_BODY is base-64 encoded, and should be decoded prior to transmission. The corresponding JSON value is type boolean.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARG_FORCE_WRAP

      public static final String ARG_FORCE_WRAP
      Optional _action=call JSON key for HTTP request, indicating that the response must be wrapped in the headers/body JSON message-format, even if the response was JSON and would otherwise have been passed-through unchanged.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ARG_AUTHENTICATE

      public static final String ARG_AUTHENTICATE
      Optional _action=call JSON key for configuring authentication to use with HTTP request. To use basic-authentication, provide a value with format, 
           {
         "type": "basic",
         "user": "...",
         "password": "..."
     }
      To use a bearer-token, 
           {
         "type": "bearer",
         "token": "..."
     }
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • actionInstance

      public org.forgerock.util.promise.Promise<org.forgerock.json.resource.ActionResponse,org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException> actionInstance(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context, org.forgerock.json.resource.ActionRequest actionRequest)
      Supports _action=call action, to make a HTTP call to an external server. The expected request payload is a JSON object containing the following fields,
      • url (required)
      • method (required)
      • headers
      • contentType
      • body
      • base64
      • forceWrap

      If the response is JSON, then the raw JSON response will be returned, otherwise the following JSON object will be returned for "text" content, 

           {
          "headers": { "Content-Type": ["..."] },
          "body": "..."
     }
      Non-text content will be base-64 encoded in the "body" field and returned as follows, 
           {
          "headers": { "Content-Type": ["..."] },
          "body": "...",
          "base64": true
     }
      Read the "Content-Type" header from the "headers" field, for guidance on how to handle the "body" content.
      Specified by:
      actionInstance in interface org.forgerock.json.resource.SingletonResourceProvider
      Parameters:
      context - Context
      actionRequest - Action request
      Returns:
      Action response
